In order to execute a donkey attack on Bitcoin, you'd need at least 3.9 million animals for the electricity - a feat even China couldn't pull off. pic.twitter.com/gXs5SVisxu

Someone asked how many donkeys needed to 51% attack Bitcoin Cash. The hashrate of $ BCH is 10% that of BTC, and say a donkey produces 1/3 of a HP. That means 400k - 2M donkeys might suffice electricity wise. Brazil or Mexico would qualify. pic.twitter.com/9ZExLJNpKu

Bitcoin miners spend 1 to 5 GW (industry estimates), that's between 1.3 and 6.3 million horsepower. In other words, by putting all the horses in the US (9M) to work producing electricity, that might suffice for a 51% attack - for now ;-)
